        public Channel(java.lang.String channelName,
               Peer me)
        Constructor for a channel without a password.
        Parameters:
        channelName - : a string to be used for the channel name
        me - : a peer object that represents the creator of the channel

      • Channel

        public Channel(java.lang.String channelName,
               Peer me,
               java.lang.String channelPass)
        Constructor for a channel with a password.
        Parameters:
        channelName - : A string to be used for the channel name.
        me - : a peer object representing the creator of the channel.
        channelPass - : a string to be used as the password for joining the channel.

    • Method Detail

      • addUserByMessage

        public Channel.JoinResponse addUserByMessage(Message joinMessage)
        Adds a user by passing hte appropriate message from him/her to it. If the channel has a password, then a PASS message needs to be supplied, if not, a JOIN message will do
        Parameters:
        joinMessage - a message object that will be used for validation of channel joining, ideally a JOIN or PASS message
        Returns:
        returns a Channel.JoinResponse enum saying whether the user is authorized to join the channel

      • hasUser

        public boolean hasUser(Peer user)
        Evaluates whether a user is part of a channel.
        Parameters:
        user - : A Peer object representing the user to check membership of the group of.
        Returns:
        returns true if the user is a member of the channel, false otherwise.

      • removeUser

        public boolean removeUser(Peer user)
        Removes a user from the channel, that user will have to rejoin (and supply the password if neccessary) if they want to continue posting messages to this channel.
        Parameters:
        user -
        Returns:
        returns true is user has been succesfully removes, false otherwise. Could return false if user was never part of the group.

      • getUsers

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getUsers()
        Get a hashmap of all the users.
        Returns:
        Hashmap
